snippet: We doctors constantly lament how difficult it is to get patients to change their behaviors, but we are equally intransigent when it comes to changing our behavior as caregivers.
abstract: Op-Ed article by medicine Prof Danielle Ofri contends that doctors are just as intransigent in persisting with bad habits as patients that they criticize for having bad diets or for continuing to smoke cigarettes; offers as example her stubbornness in accepting that performing routine general health checks for asymptomatic adults is not necessary, despite convincing research that showed it is true.
lead_paragraph: We doctors constantly lament how difficult it is to get patients to change their behaviors, but we are equally intransigent when it comes to changing our behavior as caregivers.
